remarks: Given an atom on a line, there is another atom whose join equals the line.  (Contributed by NM, 26-Jun-2012.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
llnexat.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
llnexat.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
llnexat.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
llnexat.n $e |- N = ( LLines ` K ) $.
llnexatN $p |- ( ( ( K e. HL /\ X e. N /\ P e. A ) /\ P .<_ X ) -> E. q e. A ( P =/= q /\ X = ( P .\/ q ) ) ) $.
$d .<_ q $.
$d A q $.
$d K q $.
$d N q $.
$d P q $.
$d X q $.
